contentrichtext.text: '''Edmund Michał Piszcz''' (b. November 17, 1929 in [[Bydgoszcz]], [[Poland]]) was since 22 October 1988 the [[bishop of Warmia]], [[Poland]]. On March 25, 1992, he was promoted to the rank of [[archbishop]], together with his diocese, the [[Archbishopric of Warmia]]. He retired May 30, 2006. He was awarded the German [[Bundesverdienstkreuz]] (''Großes Verdienstkreuz des Verdienstordens der Bundesrepublik Deutschland'') on 28 October 2004 for supporting German-Polish understanding, in e.g. keeping contacts to the members of [[Federation of Expellees]] from Ermland (Warmia). ==References== * [http://www.catholic-hierarchy.org/bishop/bpiszcz.html catholic-hierarchy.org profile] * Krzysztof Rafał Prokop, ''Biskupi Kościoła katolickiego w III Rzeczpospolitej. Leksykon biograficzny'', Universitas, Kraków 1998, p. 114-116 {{s-start}} {{s-rel|ca}} {{s-bef | before=[[Jan Władysław Obłąk]]}} {{s-ttl | title=[[Bishop of Warmia]]|years=1988–2006}} {{s-aft | after=[[Wojciech Ziemba]]}} {{end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Piszcz, Edmund Michal | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Catholic bishop | DATE OF BIRTH = November 17, 1929 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Piszcz, Edmund Michal}} [[Category:1929 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Commanders Crosses of the Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany]] [[Category:Bishops of Warmia]] [[Category:20th-century Roman Catholic archbishops]] [[Category:People from Bydgoszcz]] [[Category:Polish Roman Catholic archbishops]] {{Poland-RC-archbishop-stub}}
